added_lines: from oslo_utils import unitsfrom nova.virt.libvirt import hosthost.libvirt = fakelibvirt @mock.patch.object(objects.Instance, "save") @mock.patch.object(objects.Migration, "save") def test_live_migration_save_stats(self, mock_isave, mock_msave): mig = objects.Migration() info = host.DomainJobInfo( memory_total=1 * units.Gi, memory_processed=5 * units.Gi, memory_remaining=500 * units.Mi, disk_total=15 * units.Gi, disk_processed=10 * units.Gi, disk_remaining=14 * units.Gi) migration.save_stats(self.instance, mig, info, 75) self.assertEqual(mig.memory_total, 1 * units.Gi) self.assertEqual(mig.memory_processed, 5 * units.Gi) self.assertEqual(mig.memory_remaining, 500 * units.Mi) self.assertEqual(mig.disk_total, 15 * units.Gi) self.assertEqual(mig.disk_processed, 10 * units.Gi) self.assertEqual(mig.disk_remaining, 14 * units.Gi) self.assertEqual(self.instance.progress, 25) mock_msave.assert_called_once_with() mock_isave.assert_called_once_with()

commit_message:
Nexenta: Add NBD driver for NexentaEdge.

DocImpact
Implements: blueprint nexentaedge-ndb-driver

Change-Id: Iead87f00d75bfa93a06c7d2c1c6ab708bc5d804b

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import base64 import socket import mock from mock import patch from oslo_serialization import jsonutils from oslo_utils import units from cinder import context from cinder import exception from cinder import test from cinder.volume import configuration as conf from cinder.volume.drivers.nexenta.nexentaedge.nbd import NexentaEdgeNBDDriver class FakeResponse(object): def __init__(self, response): self.response = response super(FakeResponse, self).__init__() def json(self): return self.response def close(self): pass class RequestParams(object): def __init__(self, scheme, host, port, user, password): self.scheme = scheme.lower() self.host = host self.port = port self.user = user self.password = password def url(self, path=''): return '%s://%s:%s/%s' % ( self.scheme, self.host, self.port, path) @property def headers(self): auth = base64.b64encode( ('%s:%s' % (self.user, self.password)).encode('utf-8')) headers = { 'Content-Type': 'application/json', 'Authorization': 'Basic %s' % auth } return headers def build_post_args(self, args): return jsonutils.dumps(args) class TestNexentaEdgeNBDDriver(test.TestCase): def setUp(self): def _safe_get(opt): return getattr(self.cfg, opt) super(TestNexentaEdgeNBDDriver, self).setUp() self.cfg = mock.Mock(spec=conf.Configuration) self.cfg.safe_get = mock.Mock(side_effect=_safe_get) self.cfg.trace_flags = 'fake_trace_flags' self.cfg.nexenta_rest_protocol = 'http' self.cfg.nexenta_rest_address = '127.0.0.1' self.cfg.nexenta_rest_port = 8080 self.cfg.nexenta_rest_user = 'admin' self.cfg.nexenta_rest_password = '0' self.cfg.nexenta_lun_container = 'cluster/tenant/bucket' self.cfg.nexenta_nbd_symlinks_dir = '/dev/disk/by-path' self.cfg.volume_dd_blocksize = 512 self.cfg.nexenta_blocksize = 512 self.cfg.nexenta_chunksize = 4096 self.ctx = context.get_admin_context() self.drv = NexentaEdgeNBDDriver(configuration=self.cfg) self.drv.do_setup(self.ctx) self.request_params = RequestParams( 'http', self.cfg.nexenta_rest_address, self.cfg.nexenta_rest_port, self.cfg.nexenta_rest_user, self.cfg.nexenta_rest_password) def test_check_do_setup__symlinks_dir_not_specified(self): self.drv.symlinks_dir = None self.assertRaises( exception.NexentaException, self.drv.check_for_setup_error) def test_check_do_setup__symlinks_dir_doesnt_exist(self): self.drv.symlinks_dir = '/some/random/path' self.assertRaises( exception.NexentaException, self.drv.check_for_setup_error) @patch('requests.get') def test_check_do_setup__empty_response(self, get): get.return_value = FakeResponse({}) self.assertRaises(exception.VolumeBackendAPIException, self.drv.check_for_setup_error) @patch('requests.get') def test_check_do_setup(self, get): get.return_value = FakeResponse({'response': 'OK'}) self.drv.check_for_setup_error() get.assert_any_call( self.request_params.url(self.drv.bucket_url + '/objects/'), headers=self.request_params.headers) def test_local_path__error(self): self.drv._get_nbd_number = lambda volume_: -1 volume = {'name': 'volume'} self.assertRaises(exception.VolumeBackendAPIException, self.drv.local_path, volume) @patch('requests.get') def test_local_path(self, get): volume = { 'name': 'volume', 'host': 'myhost@backend#pool' } _get_host_info__response = { 'stats': { 'servers': { 'host1': { 'hostname': 'host1', 'ipv6addr': 'fe80::fc16:3eff:fedb:bd69'}, 'host2': { 'hostname': 'myhost', 'ipv6addr': 'fe80::fc16:3eff:fedb:bd68'} } } } _get_nbd_devices__response = { 'value': jsonutils.dumps([ { 'objectPath': '/'.join( (self.cfg.nexenta_lun_container, 'some_volume')), 'number': 1 }, { 'objectPath': '/'.join( (self.cfg.nexenta_lun_container, volume['name'])), 'number': 2 } ]) } def my_side_effect(*args, **kwargs): if args[0] == self.request_params.url('system/stats'): return FakeResponse({'response': _get_host_info__response}) elif args[0].startswith( self.request_params.url('sysconfig/nbd/devices')): return FakeResponse({'response': _get_nbd_devices__response}) else: raise Exception('Unexpected request') get.side_effect = my_side_effect self.drv.local_path(volume) @patch('requests.get') def test_local_path__host_not_found(self, get): volume = { 'name': 'volume', 'host': 'unknown-host@backend#pool' } _get_host_info__response = { 'stats': { 'servers': { 'host1': { 'hostname': 'host1', 'ipv6addr': 'fe80::fc16:3eff:fedb:bd69'}, 'host2': { 'hostname': 'myhost', 'ipv6addr': 'fe80::fc16:3eff:fedb:bd68'} } } } _get_nbd_devices__response = { 'value': jsonutils.dumps([ { 'objectPath': '/'.join( (self.cfg.nexenta_lun_container, 'some_volume')), 'number': 1 }, { 'objectPath': '/'.join( (self.cfg.nexenta_lun_container, volume['name'])), 'number': 2 } ]) } def my_side_effect(*args, **kwargs): if args[0] == self.request_params.url('system/stats'): return FakeResponse({'response': _get_host_info__response}) elif args[0].startswith( self.request_params.url('sysconfig/nbd/devices')): return FakeResponse({'response': _get_nbd_devices__response}) else: raise Exception('Unexpected request') get.side_effect = my_side_effect self.assertRaises(exception.VolumeBackendAPIException, self.drv.local_path, volume) @patch('cinder.utils.execute') @patch('requests.post') def test_create_volume(self, post, execute): post.returning_value = FakeResponse({}) volume = { 'host': 'host@backend#pool info', 'size': 1, 'name': 'volume' } number = 5 remote_url = '' self.drv._get_remote_url = lambda host_: remote_url self.drv._get_nbd_number = lambda volume_: number self.drv.create_volume(volume) post.assert_called_with( self.request_params.url('nbd' + remote_url), data=self.request_params.build_post_args({ 'objectPath': '/'.join((self.cfg.nexenta_lun_container, volume['name'])), 'volSizeMB': volume['size'] * units.Ki, 'blockSize': self.cfg.nexenta_blocksize, 'chunkSize': self.cfg.nexenta_chunksize}), headers=self.request_params.headers) @patch('requests.delete') def test_delete_volume(self, delete): delete.returning_value = FakeResponse({}) volume = { 'host': 'host@backend#pool info', 'size': 1, 'name': 'volume' } number = 5 remote_url = '' self.drv._get_remote_url = lambda host_: remote_url self.drv._get_nbd_number = lambda volume_: number self.drv.delete_volume(volume) delete.assert_called_with( self.request_params.url('nbd' + remote_url), data=self.request_params.build_post_args({ 'objectPath': '/'.join((self.cfg.nexenta_lun_container, volume['name'])), 'number': number}), headers=self.request_params.headers) @patch('requests.delete') def test_delete_volume__not_found(self, delete): delete.returning_value = FakeResponse({}) volume = { 'host': 'host@backend#pool info', 'size': 1, 'name': 'volume' } remote_url = '' self.drv._get_remote_url = lambda host_: remote_url self.drv._get_nbd_number = lambda volume_: -1 self.drv.delete_volume(volume) delete.assert_not_called() @patch('requests.put') def test_extend_volume(self, put): put.returning_value = FakeResponse({}) volume = { 'host': 'host@backend#pool info', 'size': 1, 'name': 'volume' } new_size = 5 remote_url = '' self.drv._get_remote_url = lambda host_: remote_url self.drv.extend_volume(volume, new_size) put.assert_called_with( self.request_params.url('nbd/resize' + remote_url), data=self.request_params.build_post_args({ 'objectPath': '/'.join((self.cfg.nexenta_lun_container, volume['name'])), 'newSizeMB': new_size * units.Ki}), headers=self.request_params.headers) @patch('requests.post') def test_create_snapshot(self, post): post.returning_value = FakeResponse({}) snapshot = { 'name': 'dsfsdsdgfdf', 'volume_name': 'volume' } self.drv.create_snapshot(snapshot) post.assert_called_with( self.request_params.url('nbd/snapshot'), data=self.request_params.build_post_args({ 'objectPath': '/'.join((self.cfg.nexenta_lun_container, snapshot['volume_name'])), 'snapName': snapshot['name']}), headers=self.request_params.headers) @patch('requests.delete') def test_delete_snapshot(self, delete): delete.returning_value = FakeResponse({}) snapshot = { 'name': 'dsfsdsdgfdf', 'volume_name': 'volume' } self.drv.delete_snapshot(snapshot) delete.assert_called_with( self.request_params.url('nbd/snapshot'), data=self.request_params.build_post_args({ 'objectPath': '/'.join((self.cfg.nexenta_lun_container, snapshot['volume_name'])), 'snapName': snapshot['name']}), headers=self.request_params.headers) @patch('requests.put') def test_create_volume_from_snapshot(self, put): put.returning_value = FakeResponse({}) snapshot = { 'name': 'dsfsdsdgfdf', 'volume_name': 'volume' } volume = { 'host': 'host@backend#pool info', 'size': 1, 'name': 'volume' } remote_url = '' self.drv._get_remote_url = lambda host_: remote_url self.drv.create_volume_from_snapshot(volume, snapshot) put.assert_called_with( self.request_params.url('nbd/snapshot/clone' + remote_url), data=self.request_params.build_post_args({ 'objectPath': '/'.join((self.cfg.nexenta_lun_container, snapshot['volume_name'])), 'snapName': snapshot['name'], 'clonePath': '/'.join((self.cfg.nexenta_lun_container, volume['name'])) }), headers=self.request_params.headers) @patch('requests.post') def test_ccreate_cloned_volume(self, post): post.returning_value = FakeResponse({}) volume = { 'host': 'host@backend#pool info', 'size': 1, 'name': 'volume' } src_vref = { 'size': 1, 'name': 'qwerty' } container = self.cfg.nexenta_lun_container remote_url = '' self.drv._get_remote_url = lambda host_: remote_url self.drv.create_cloned_volume(volume, src_vref) post.assert_called_with( self.request_params.url('nbd' + remote_url), data=self.request_params.build_post_args({ 'objectPath': '/'.join((container, volume['name'])), 'volSizeMB': src_vref['size'] * units.Ki, 'blockSize': self.cfg.nexenta_blocksize, 'chunkSize': self.cfg.nexenta_chunksize }), headers=self.request_params.headers) def test_get_volume_stats(self): self.cfg.volume_backend_name = None location_info = '%(driver)s:%(host)s:%(bucket)s' % { 'driver': self.drv.__class__.__name__, 'host': socket.gethostname(), 'bucket': self.cfg.nexenta_lun_container } expected = { 'vendor_name': 'Nexenta', 'driver_version': self.drv.VERSION, 'storage_protocol': 'NBD', 'reserved_percentage': 0, 'total_capacity_gb': 'unknown', 'free_capacity_gb': 'unknown', 'QoS_support': False, 'volume_backend_name': self.drv.__class__.__name__, 'location_info': location_info, 'restapi_url': self.request_params.url() } self.assertEqual(expected, self.drv.get_volume_stats()) @patch('cinder.image.image_utils.fetch_to_raw') def test_copy_image_to_volume(self, fetch_to_raw): volume = { 'host': 'host@backend#pool info', 'size': 1, 'name': 'volume' } self.drv.local_path = lambda host: 'local_path' self.drv.copy_image_to_volume(self.ctx, volume, 'image_service', 'image_id') fetch_to_raw.assert_called_with( self.ctx, 'image_service', 'image_id', 'local_path', self.cfg.volume_dd_blocksize, size=volume['size']) @patch('cinder.image.image_utils.upload_volume') def test_copy_volume_to_image(self, upload_volume): volume = { 'host': 'host@backend#pool info', 'size': 1, 'name': 'volume' } self.drv.local_path = lambda host: 'local_path' self.drv.copy_volume_to_image(self.ctx, volume, 'image_service', 'image_meta') upload_volume.assert_called_with( self.ctx, 'image_service', 'image_meta', 'local_path') @patch('requests.get') def test_validate_connector(self, get): connector = {'host': 'host2'} r = { 'stats': { 'servers': { 'host1': {'hostname': 'host1'}, 'host2': {'hostname': 'host2'} } } } get.return_value = FakeResponse({'response': r}) self.drv.validate_connector(connector) get.assert_called_with(self.request_params.url('system/stats'), headers=self.request_params.headers) @patch('requests.get') def test_validate_connector__host_not_found(self, get): connector = {'host': 'host3'} r = { 'stats': { 'servers': { 'host1': {'hostname': 'host1'}, 'host2': {'hostname': 'host2'} } } } get.return_value = FakeResponse({'response': r}) self.assertRaises(exception.VolumeBackendAPIException, self.drv.validate_connector, connector) def test_initialize_connection(self): connector = {'host': 'host'} volume = { 'host': 'host@backend#pool info', 'size': 1, 'name': 'volume' } self.drv.local_path = lambda host: 'local_path' self.assertEqual({ 'driver_volume_type': 'local', 'data': {'device_path': 'local_path'}}, self.drv.initialize_connection(volume, connector))

commit_message:
[WIP] Suport A/A in attach/detach operations

This patch allows attaching and detaching volumes in HA Active-Active
configurations.

To allow the attach and detach of volumes in Cinder using the cluster
topic queue in the Message Broker following RPC methods in
cinder/volume/rpcapi has been changed:

- attach_volume
- detach_volume
- initialize_connection
- terminate_connection
- remove_export

When the cluster field is not set for a volume all RPC calls will behave
as before, sending it to the host topic queue.

Specs: https://review.openstack.org/327283 Implements: blueprint
cinder-volume-active-active-support Change-Id:
I6ec689ea8abb10832a47b20f82bf2e710c62deae

Change-Id: I23f8bfbf3d2cbd8b04a148c762d6b72c244f02cb

added_lines: def _get_volume_cctxt(self, volume, version): # NOTE(geguileo): If we have a cluster we can send directly to it # because there is at least 1 c-vol node (the one that filled the # cluster field) listing that topic queue. server = volume.cluster_name or volume.host cctxt = self._get_cctxt(server, version) return cctxt cctxt = self._get_volume_cctxt(volume, '2.0') volume_id=volume.id, cctxt = self._get_volume_cctxt(volume, '2.0') return cctxt.call(ctxt, 'detach_volume', volume_id=volume.id, cctxt = self._get_volume_cctxt(volume, '2.0') volume_id=volume.id, cctxt = self._get_volume_cctxt(volume, '2.0') return cctxt.call(ctxt, 'terminate_connection', volume_id=volume.id, cctxt = self._get_volume_cctxt(volume, '2.0') cctxt.cast(ctxt, 'remove_export', volume_id=volume.id)
deleted_lines: cctxt = self._get_cctxt(volume['host'], '2.0') volume_id=volume['id'], cctxt = self._get_cctxt(volume['host'], '2.0') return cctxt.call(ctxt, 'detach_volume', volume_id=volume['id'], cctxt = self._get_cctxt(volume['host'], '2.0') volume_id=volume['id'], cctxt = self._get_cctxt(volume['host'], '2.0') return cctxt.call(ctxt, 'terminate_connection', volume_id=volume['id'], cctxt = self._get_cctxt(volume['host'], '2.0') cctxt.cast(ctxt, 'remove_export', volume_id=volume['id'])

Support pruning a time range in vertica

Change-Id: I66b95e15804603b7b9f2f4fee9e79609f04cd849
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-monasca refs/changes/79/334679/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: limit_ignore_group = parser.add_mutually_exclusive_group() date_group = parser.add_mutually_exclusive_group(required=True) limit_ignore_group.add_argument('-l', '--limit', required=False, nargs='+', help=help_text) limit_ignore_group.add_argument('-i', '--ignore', required=False, nargs='+', help=help_text) date_group.add_argument('-r', '--retain_days', required=False, help=help_text) help_text = """ Start time of the pruning period. """ date_group.add_argument('-s', '--start_time', required=False, help=help_text) help_text = """ End time of the pruning period. """ parser.add_argument('-e', '--end_time', required=False, print "Error: Pruning the admin project is not allowed!" sys.exit(1) if args.start_time and not args.end_time: print "Error: Please provide both start and end time." sys.exit(1) if args.start_time and args.end_time and not args.start_time < args.end_time: print "Error: Start time must preceed end time." run_time = get_isotime(now) print "Database pruning executing at %s" % run_time if args.retain_days: retain_time = get_isotime(now - (int(args.retain_days) * 60 * 60 * 24)) time_clause = "time_stamp < '%s'" % retain_time print "Keeping records more recent than %s" % retain_time else: print "Pruning records between %s and %s" % (args.start_time, args.end_time) time_clause = "time_stamp >= '%s' and time_stamp <= '%s'" % (args.start_time, args.end_time) WHERE %s vsql(delete_sql % (time_clause, limit_clause)) vsql(delete_sql % (time_clause, non_admin_with_ignore_clause)) vsql(delete_sql % (time_clause, admin_clause)) vsql(delete_sql % (time_clause, non_admin_clause)) vsql(delete_sql % (time_clause, admin_clause))
deleted_lines: group = parser.add_mutually_exclusive_group() group.add_argument('-l', '--limit', required=False, nargs='+', help=help_text) group.add_argument('-i', '--ignore', required=False, nargs='+', help=help_text) parser.add_argument('-r', '--retain_days', required=True, print "Pruning the admin project is not allowed!" start_time = get_isotime(now) retain_time = get_isotime(now - (int(args.retain_days) * 60 * 60 * 24)) print "Database pruning executing at %s" % start_time print "Keeping records later than %s" % retain_time WHERE time_stamp < '%s' vsql(delete_sql % (retain_time, limit_clause)) vsql(delete_sql % (retain_time, non_admin_with_ignore_clause)) vsql(delete_sql % (retain_time, admin_clause)) vsql(delete_sql % (retain_time, non_admin_clause)) vsql(delete_sql % (retain_time, admin_clause))

commit_message:
Revert "Remove unused service tags and client"

This change is breaking jobs that run Sahara tests, because tempest/config.py is still requiring data_processing service tag.

We didn't see it in Puppet jobs, because we are pinning tempest since yesterday, our CI was broken, so we didn't test this patch at all.

We need to re-write this patch to completely clean data_processing usage.

This reverts commit 22b3008661387bfdb7dfa19813a043c3c9168724.

Change-Id: I088b30742650f2052d3457226a0f24efa3625e3e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/97/335097/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix upgrades fail to upgrade

The docker client remove operation returns an exception that was
resulting in upgrades not to work.  After the removal operation
when a nova VM had been spawned, the libvirt container no longer was
running, but btrfs was unable to delete the data.  However, we can
still proceed with an ugprade in this scenario.

Change-Id: Ic9c57e0894c19da978355cedb09be49e10e01501
Closes-Bug: #1596653

commit_message:
Revert "carbonara: compress all TimeSerie classes using LZ4"

This reverts commit bcf9af7ee11e16d15e3df013dc4af91b24257234.

We prefer to manage clearly the transition to a better compression
scheme later.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-15 21:00:44.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/callbacks/manager.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/callbacks/test_manager.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/2fbb6587df357583fe03b8616d7b95f79382af20', 'message': 'Allow self-unsubscribing callbacks

This adjusts the notify loop logic to handle the case where
a callback causes a subscription or unsubscription that changes
the subscriber dictionary to change during iteration.

It was just using .items() which solved the problem for py27 but
was not creating an actual copy in py34. This just calls list()

Change-Id: Iee9d675faf30ec714b4f5c77128d8843d545ecfd
Closes-Bug: #1592983
'}]
commit_message:
Allow self-unsubscribing callbacks

This adjusts the notify loop logic to handle the case where
a callback causes a subscription or unsubscription that changes
the subscriber dictionary to change during iteration.

It was just using .items() which solved the problem for py27 but
was not creating an actual copy in py34. This just calls list()
on .items() to make sure we get a list in both cases.

Change-Id: Iee9d675faf30ec714b4f5c77128d8843d545ecfd
Closes-Bug: #1592983

commit_message:
add warnings for malformated input

Log warnings if the input doesn't match the type of data
expected. Eventually we may want to enforce these rules by raising
exceptions, but for now it should be enough to help someone debug their
problem to just print a warning.

Change-Id: I9016041bf13e9047d1894d2284b57b0a94554977
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Fix restore tar error handling

Capture errors from tar during restore and log them.
Propogate restore tar errors up thru the exception mechanism.
Refactor process check to remove duplicate code.
Propagate exceptions from tar for both backup and restore
up to main instead of exiting the process.

Change-Id: I43de55e271a34d7b497760905f168d2d7a3ab28c
Closes-Bug: #1595670

added_lines: self.check_process_output(tar_process, 'Backup') finally: self.check_process_output(tar_process, 'Restore') @staticmethod def check_process_output(process, function): """Check process stderr and return code to determine if error occurred. Check process stderr for any non-empty value. Check process return code for any non-zero value. Log error message and raise an exception if error occurred. :param process: the multiprocessing process to check :param function: a string: ('Restore' | 'Backup') for error message :returns: None -- Do nothing and return None if no error occurred :raises: Exception -- Raise Exception if error occurred """ tar_err = process.communicate()[1] if tar_err: logging.exception('[*] {0} error: {1}'.format(function, tar_err)) raise Exception(tar_err) if process.returncode: logging.error('[*] {0} return code is not 0') raise Exception('{} process failed with return code: {1}' .format(function, process.returncode))
deleted_lines: tar_err = tar_process.communicate()[1] if tar_err: logging.exception('[*] Backup error: {0}'.format(tar_err)) os._exit(1) if tar_process.returncode: logging.error('[*] Backup return code is not 0') os._exit(1) @staticmethod def check_process_output(process): tar_err = process.communicate()[1] if tar_err: logging.exception('[*] Restore error: {0}'.format(tar_err)) os._exit(1) if process.returncode: logging.error('[*] Restore return code is not 0') os._exit(1) self.check_process_output(tar_process)

commit_message:
Add tempest tests for user messages

This commit adds basic tests for the list/show/delete
APIs for Manila's new user messages.

Partially Implements: Blueprint user-messages

commit_message:
Add server uuid to console URLs

Console auth tokens are being saved in the database instead
of in memory in the console auth server. With cells V2 this
will be the child cell database. Console URLs currently only
include a token, which is not enough for the console proxy to
find the cell that has the token and connection information
if it is deployed at the api level. So we add the instance
uuid to the URL query string (as a parameter called 'server')
to allow it to find the correct cell.

This change is compatible with the existing console proxies
so it is safe to do it first. Later patches will add code
to the proxies to retrieve console auth tokens from the
database.

Change-Id: I596ea9cf85b1b853389f11e0200fcd06cb55094a
partially-implements: blueprint convert-consoles-to-objects

subject: Fix gate failures due to change in provisioning behavior.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-27 18:08:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/commit/7fab4ee270c21cd110388c01670a7ff4d1cbf41b', 'message': "Fix gate failures due to change in provisioning behavior.

This commit:

https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/commit/ea9cf4b0ba350d64fffe272e389182e198b785f3

Changed how provision/local works, and how  how provision/remote
plays into quickstart invocation.

This patch attempts to get the gate's unblocked (first).  WIP pending
additional patch revisions to fix/address teardown needs.

The image build role assumes that virthost is already set (and handles the
case where it's not).  This decouples the image-build role from
tripleo-quickstart cleanly, and allows for other ways virthost might be
specified.  (Note: we shouldrename it to build-virthost or something similar)

- provision/local again adds virthost --> inventory (dynamic)
- remove ----------------^  from quickstart.yml
- disable --teardown default options (for now)
- restore loss of fidelity in comments regarding why re-add to inventory
  to handle change of user

commit_message:
Fix gate failures due to change in provisioning behavior.

Due to the change in provisioning behavior we need to add
the virthost to the in memory inventory in the provision/local role.

This is redundant for quickstart.yml, but the task is idempotent.

Change-Id: I0c56e5d05d523234bdb37dbf48744d96c78a65cd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/00/334600/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Add the virthost to the in-memory inventory. The inventory is not # wirtten out to disk unless you call the `rebuild-inventory` role. - name: Add the virthost to the inventory add_host: name: "{{virthost}}" groups: "virthost" ansible_fqdn: "{{ virthost }}" ansible_user: "root" ansible_host: "{{ virthost }}"

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-06 22:50:58.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/mech_driver/mech_openvswitch.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/376dd5e140e7676bbb99e5f5875541312b689b82', 'message': "[WIP] Provide is_trunk boolean in vif details from OVS mechanism driver

This patch follows up on the changes in
https://review.openstack.org/320092 that include the addition of a
'trunk_details' extension for trunk ports. When a port is used to create
a trunk, the port will contain a non-empty value in its 'trunk_details'
key.

If the port is a trunk, pass an 'is_trunk' boolean field in the
vif_details so that the vif driver can choose the correct vif-plugging
method for plugging trunk ports.

Change-Id: I735ecb95f208e44d35b9c394798ea699e03ab083
Partially-Implements: blueprint vlan-aware-vms

commit_message:
[WIP] Provide is_trunk boolean in vif details from OVS mechanism driver

This patch follows up on the changes in
https://review.openstack.org/320092 that include the addition of a
'trunk_details' extension for trunk ports. When a port is used to create
a trunk, the port will contain a non-empty value in its 'trunk_details'
key.

If the port is a trunk, pass an 'is_trunk' boolean field in the
vif_details so that the vif driver can choose the correct vif-plugging
method for plugging trunk ports.

Change-Id: I735ecb95f208e44d35b9c394798ea699e03ab083
Partially-Implements: blueprint vlan-aware-vms
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/65/326165/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: is_trunk = True if context.current.get('trunk_details', {}) else False return self._add_trunk_vif_details(details, is_trunk) vif_details = { return self._add_trunk_vif_details(vif_details, is_trunk) return self._add_trunk_vif_details(self.vif_details, is_trunk) def _add_trunk_vif_details(self, vif_details, is_trunk): """Add is_trunk field to vif_details, making a copy when overriding the agent's vif_details """ new_vif_details = (dict(vif_details) if vif_details is self.vif_details else vif_details) if is_trunk: new_vif_details['is_trunk'] = True return new_vif_details

commit_message:
Switch defaults for nova upgrade parameters to $::os_service_default

This patch switches defaults for nova upgrade parameters to our common
fact $::os_service_default, that help us to reduce lines of code
for huge main nova class.

Change-Id: I29d238c12a39cac0bf564d6332b7bce2552bd5b4

commit_message:
Fix file permission in dib elements

After the recent move [1] of diskimage-buidler elements
the permissions where changed making the files non-executable.
Make them executable again.

[1] I98051da7e9c8f7943fb5fe2109989d66b4b03736

Change-Id: I8dc819470c3089beb62a76364d4b6b4ba6e12d34

commit_message:
devstack: do not wait for service to start

There's no reason to wait for ceilometer-api to start, as everything
should be resilient anyway.

(and currently that breaks the gate)

Change-Id: I3c381a43bb7ddc5f873d60bb13e27bc029ccca10

commit_message:
Manually set changed fields for cell healing

Cell healing has been updated to work by sending instance objects
up to the global cell.  The global cell then computes the changes to
sync based on the instance object's changed fields.  However, since the
instance object was freshly loaded from the DB, this list of changes is
always empty.

This patch fixes it by manually marking the fields in the instance
object as changed.

Closes-Bug: 1552050

Change-Id: I047c30b859698c3bdc40aad582b29074f58b1d12

deleted_lines: instances = ['instance1', 'instance2', 'instance3'] return iter(instances) call_info['sync_instances'].append(instance) self.assertEqual(instances[:2], call_info['sync_instances']) self.assertEqual([instances[-1], instances[0]], call_info['sync_instances'])

commit_message:
Fix npm-run false positives

Due to `npm run` exit code not being correctly preserved, `npm
shrinkwrap` exit code was being returned instead of `npm run` exit
code, leading to test jobs passing when actually they shouldn't had
passed.

Change-Id: I4dbaefa8a9622a8c681a7733296c0a65ed6a82a1
Closes-Bug: #1595938

commit_message:
vcenter detection plugin throws IndexError

If nova-compute process is running with the configuration file named
other than 'hypervisor.conf', vcenter detection plugin throws IndexError
exception when it manipulates the parameter of the process.
Fix the plugin to skip the process which doesn't have 'hypervisor.conf'
parameter.

Change-Id: I913bf206d3ae87694f9be7ab03a60d03dcb60d80
Closes-Bug: #1595879
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/monasca-agent refs/changes/53/334153/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: param = [cmd.index(y) for y in cmd if 'hypervisor.conf' in y][0]

added_lines: Both of the APIs currently have two major versions: v1 (SUPPORTED) and v2 (CURRENT). You can run either or both versions by setting appropriate values of ``enable_v1_api``, ``enable_v2_api``, ``enable_v1_registry``, and ``enable_v2_registry``. If the v2 API is used, running ``glance-registry`` is optional, as v2 of ``glance-api`` can connect directly to the database. To assist you in formulating your deployment strategy for the Image APIs, the Glance team has published a statement concerning the status and development plans of the APIs: `Using public Image API <http://docs.openstack.org/developer/glance/glanceapi.html>`_.
deleted_lines: Both of the APIs currently have two major versions, v1 and v2. It is possible to run either or both versions, by setting appropriate values of ``enable_v1_api``, ``enable_v2_api``, ``enable_v1_registry`` and ``enable_v2_registry``. If the v2 API is used, running ``glance-registry`` is optional, as v2 of ``glance-api`` can connect directly to the database.

commit_message:
Docs: Fix rendering of :orphan:

This patch removes the ``:orphan:`` docinfo from the documentation
and instead adds the orphaned docs into the ``exclude_pattern``
configuration option. There's a bug that causes the tag to actually
get rendered in the docs when those docs are brought in via an
include.

commit_message:
Add doc Makefile

Developing documentation source in RST it's much easier
when doc changes can be built and verified locally.
This patch adds a Makefile that allows the docs to built
with a simple 'make' from your shell/term.

The Makefile was taken from neutron [1].

[1] https://goo.gl/PyOMcG

Change-Id: I019ad63067bb57d80709f025de226448f3aa2596
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lib refs/changes/15/331315/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Makefile for Sphinx documentation # # You can set these variables from the command line. SPHINXOPTS = SPHINXBUILD = sphinx-build SPHINXSOURCE = source PAPER = BUILDDIR = build # Internal variables. PAPEROPT_a4 = -D latex_paper_size=a4 PAPEROPT_letter = -D latex_paper_size=letter ALLSPHINXOPTS = -d $(BUILDDIR)/doctrees $(PAPEROPT_$(PAPER)) $(SPHINXOPTS) $(SPHINXSOURCE) .PHONY: help clean html dirhtml pickle json htmlhelp qthelp latex changes linkcheck doctest .DEFAULT_GOAL = html help: @echo "Please use \`make <target>' where <target> is one of" @echo " html to make standalone HTML files" @echo " dirhtml to make HTML files named index.html in directories" @echo " pickle to make pickle files" @echo " json to make JSON files" @echo " htmlhelp to make HTML files and a HTML help project" @echo " qthelp to make HTML files and a qthelp project" @echo " latex to make LaTeX files, you can set PAPER=a4 or PAPER=letter" @echo " changes to make an overview of all changed/added/deprecated items" @echo " linkcheck to check all external links for integrity" @echo " doctest to run all doctests embedded in the documentation (if enabled)" clean: -rm -rf $(BUILDDIR)/* if [ -f .autogenerated ] ; then \ cat .autogenerated | xargs rm ; \ rm .autogenerated ; \ fi html: $(SPHINXBUILD) -b html $(ALLSPHINXOPTS) $(BUILDDIR)/html @echo @echo "Build finished. The HTML pages are in $(BUILDDIR)/html." dirhtml: $(SPHINXBUILD) -b dirhtml $(ALLSPHINXOPTS) $(BUILDDIR)/dirhtml @echo @echo "Build finished. The HTML pages are in $(BUILDDIR)/dirhtml." pickle: $(SPHINXBUILD) -b pickle $(ALLSPHINXOPTS) $(BUILDDIR)/pickle @echo @echo "Build finished; now you can process the pickle files." json: $(SPHINXBUILD) -b json $(ALLSPHINXOPTS) $(BUILDDIR)/json @echo @echo "Build finished; now you can process the JSON files." htmlhelp: $(SPHINXBUILD) -b htmlhelp $(ALLSPHINXOPTS) $(BUILDDIR)/htmlhelp @echo @echo "Build finished; now you can run HTML Help Workshop with the" \ ".hhp project file in $(BUILDDIR)/htmlhelp." qthelp: $(SPHINXBUILD) -b qthelp $(ALLSPHINXOPTS) $(BUILDDIR)/qthelp @echo @echo "Build finished; now you can run "qcollectiongenerator" with the" \ ".qhcp project file in $(BUILDDIR)/qthelp, like this:" @echo "# qcollectiongenerator $(BUILDDIR)/qthelp/nova.qhcp" @echo "To view the help file:" @echo "# assistant -collectionFile $(BUILDDIR)/qthelp/nova.qhc" latex: $(SPHINXBUILD) -b latex $(ALLSPHINXOPTS) $(BUILDDIR)/latex @echo @echo "Build finished; the LaTeX files are in $(BUILDDIR)/latex." @echo "Run \`make all-pdf' or \`make all-ps' in that directory to" \ "run these through (pdf)latex." changes: $(SPHINXBUILD) -b changes $(ALLSPHINXOPTS) $(BUILDDIR)/changes @echo @echo "The overview file is in $(BUILDDIR)/changes." linkcheck: $(SPHINXBUILD) -b linkcheck $(ALLSPHINXOPTS) $(BUILDDIR)/linkcheck @echo @echo "Link check complete; look for any errors in the above output " \ "or in $(BUILDDIR)/linkcheck/output.txt." doctest: $(SPHINXBUILD) -b doctest $(ALLSPHINXOPTS) $(BUILDDIR)/doctest @echo "Testing of doctests in the sources finished, look at the " \ "results in $(BUILDDIR)/doctest/output.txt."

commit_message:
Docs: Fix rendering of :orphan:

This patch removes the ``:orphan:`` docinfo from the documentation
and instead adds the orphaned docs into the ``exclude_pattern``
configuration option. There's a bug that causes the tag to actually
get rendered in the docs when those docs are brought in via an
include.

Backport-of: Iacce8f5bfd9a629117564938bbb376bf5abcec31

Change-Id: I815070d1de924c9c4ec7c21098acb6c52baac3b8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-security refs/changes/86/334586/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove unused service tags and client

This commit removes unused service tags and a client. We should keep our
code clean as possible.

Change-Id: I428ac6740feaaabdd17a02a03ea5230d202d89d2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/13/334313/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: services = ['compute', 'image', 'baremetal', 'volume', 'network', 'identity', 'object_storage']

commit_message:
DevStack plugin for fwaas

Start by just running the cookiecutter code - documented at [1]. Then
scrape out the fwaas/firewall code from DevStack and stick it where it
looks like it should be in the plugin.

[1]: http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack-dev/devstack-plugin-cookiecutter/tree/README.rst

Related-Change: Ic60cd1fa90c19dfac00be583e2ddc5633dbb68a3
Co-Authored-By: Nate Johnston <Nate_Johnston@cable.comcast.com>
Co-Authored-By: German Eichberger <german.eichberger@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Kyle Mestery <mestery@mestery.com>

Change-Id: If6c6e032689392fecc8c24517666128c8c103a7b
Signed-of-by: Kyle Mestery <mestery@mestery.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-fwaas refs/changes/50/214350/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: enable_service q-fwaas

subject: Add entrypoints for iptables and varmor drivers

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-23 18:32:10.000000000', 'files': ['setup.cfg'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-fwaas/commit/b26f9f46af4945b7770e90a9bed80ae451b752c5', 'message': 'Add entrypoints for iptables and varmor drivers

Change-Id: I816df2e3c86d933587e7e69259466470e38ad430

commit_message:
Add transport_url parameters for oslo.messaging

This commit adds the transport_url parameters for oslo.messaging. The
url is of the form:

  transport://user:pass@host1:port[,hostN:portN]/virtual_host

Where the transport scheme specifies the rpc or notification backend
as one of rabbit, amqp, zmq, etc. Oslo.messaging is deprecating the
host, port, and auth configuration options [1]. All drivers will get
these options via the transport_url.

This patch:
* use oslo::messaging::default resource
* use oslo::messaging::notifications resource
* add parameters for transport_url(s)
* correct config file for amqp backend
* update spec tests
* add feature release note

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/317285/

Change-Id: I8d0132f23aa05ed267ff2d88bce61ce9f20160f5

commit_message:
Add goal_name field in strategy

This patch set adds goal_name field in strategy
Related-Bug: #1590416.

Change-Id: Ia381dd882b244487f8beec4d04dabddd1ac7dbc7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/watcher refs/changes/51/331551/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: _goal_name = None def _get_goal_name(self): return self._goal_name def _set_goal_name(self, value): if value and self._goal_name != value: self._goal_name = None goal = self._get_goal(value) if goal: self._goal_name = goal.name goal_name = wsme.wsproperty(wtypes.text, _get_goal_name, _set_goal_name, mandatory=False) """The name of the goal this audit refers to""" self.fields.append('goal_name') setattr(self, 'goal_name', kwargs.get('goal_id', wtypes.Unset)) ['uuid', 'name', 'display_name', 'goal_uuid', 'goal_name'])

commit_message:
carbonara: compress all TimeSerie classes using LZ4

This fixes the compression not being used by previous version of Gnocchi due to
a misimplementation of the serializing code.

Change-Id: I6d0c45fc4987c5b84dd5a4664b8065498513d080
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/gnocchi refs/changes/67/333367/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: try: uncompressed = lz4.loads(data) except ValueError: uncompressed = data return cls.from_dict(msgpack.loads(uncompressed, encoding='utf-8')) return lz4.dumps(msgpack.dumps(self.to_dict()))
deleted_lines: return cls.from_dict(msgpack.loads(data, encoding='utf-8')) return msgpack.dumps(self.to_dict()) @classmethod def unserialize(cls, data): return cls.from_dict(msgpack.loads(lz4.loads(data), encoding='utf-8')) def serialize(self): return lz4.dumps(msgpack.dumps(self.to_dict()))

to neutron_lib; this addresses them.

commit_message:
Create Share Snapshot modal form refactoring

This patch removes some redundant code from html template, fixes
cancel button and changes success url to snapshots tab.

Change-Id: If108edc085249ee3b8bd7ce09766ec1330e4e60d
Partially-Implements: blueprint form-templates
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila-ui refs/changes/19/334919/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from openstack_dashboard.usage import quotasSHARE_SNAPSHOTS_TAB_URL = reverse('horizon:project:shares:snapshots_tab') def test_create_snapshot_get(self): share = test_data.share usage_limit = { 'maxTotalShareGigabytes': 250, 'totalShareGigabytesUsed': 20, } url = reverse('horizon:project:shares:create_snapshot', args=[share.id]) self.mock_object( quotas, "tenant_limit_usages", mock.Mock(return_value=usage_limit)) self.mock_object( api_manila, "share_get", mock.Mock(return_value=share)) self.mock_object( neutron, "is_service_enabled", mock.Mock(return_value=[True])) res = self.client.get(url) api_manila.share_get.assert_called_once_with(mock.ANY, share.id) self.assertNoMessages() self.assertTemplateUsed( res, 'project/shares/snapshots/create_snapshot.html') def test_create_snapshot_post(self): self.assertRedirectsNoFollow(res, SHARE_SNAPSHOTS_TAB_URL)

subject: Enhance help message for senlin event show CLI
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-24 09:42:06.000000000', 'files': ['senlinclient/v1/event.py', 'senlinclient/v1/shell.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-senlinclient/commit/0ed18c6eb2b723943733babebf14cb272512ef7a', 'message': "Enhance help message for senlin event show CLI

The '<event>' help message for 'openstack help cluster event show'
and 'senlin help event-show' isn't quite complete. Enhance it to
make it easier to understand and translater for i18n team, and be
in the standard as 'openstack help server show', 'openstack help
volume show' and so on

Change-Id: Idd7df9e195fc3bb01b4dee19bc62e17e4702b7c0
Closes-Bug: 1595895
"}]
commit_message:
Enhance help message for senlin event show CLI

The '<event>' help message for 'openstack help cluster event show'
and 'senlin help event-show' isn't quite complete. Enhance it to
make it easier to understand and translater for i18n team, and be
in the standard as 'openstack help server show', 'openstack help
volume show' and so on

Change-Id: Idd7df9e195fc3bb01b4dee19bc62e17e4702b7c0
Closes-Bug: 1595895
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-senlinclient refs/changes/35/333835/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @utils.arg('id', metavar='<event>', help=_('Event to display (ID).'))
deleted_lines: @utils.arg('id', metavar='<EVENT>', help=_('ID of event to display details for.'))

commit_message:
Convert element_dependencies to logging

Use standard logging module for output.  Add some basic testing of
error messages to the unit-tests.  Use the logging_config module to
setup the logging for interactive use.

Change-Id: Ia23722a7bd00aba336118edb155356a3b3ef6926
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/72/328072/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import loggingimport logging_config logger = logging.getLogger(__name__) logger.error("ERROR: Element '%s' not found in '%s'" % (element, elements_dir)) logger.error( "Please include an operating system element.") logger.error("Following elements were explicitly required " "but are provided by other included elements: %s" % ", ".join(conflicts)) logging_config.setup() logger.warning("expand-dependencies flag is deprecated, " "and is now on by default.", file=sys.stderr)
deleted_lines:
sys.stderr.write("ERROR: Element '%s' not found in '%s'
" % (element, elements_dir)) sys.stderr.write( "ERROR: Please include an operating system element.
") sys.stderr.write("ERROR: Following elements were explicitly required " "but are provided by other included elements: %s
" % ", ".join(conflicts)) print("WARNING: expand-dependencies flag is deprecated, " "and is now on by default.", file=sys.stderr)

subject: Two stage transformation
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-03 03:03:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/monasca-transform/commit/1245ebc25d162c526b57fefe1c353c69e81b1c4d', 'message': 'Two stage transformation
Breaking down the aggregation into two stages. The first stage aggregates
raw metrics frequently and is implemented as a Spark Streaming job which
aggregates metrics at a configurable time interval (defaults to 10 minutes)
and writes the intermediate aggregated data, or instance usage data
to new "metrics_pre_hourly" kafka topic. The second stage is implemented
as a batch job using Spark Streaming createRDD API, which is triggered
by the first stage only when first stage runs at the top of the hour.
Also enhanced kafka offsets table to keep track of offsets from two
stages along with streaming batch time, last time version row got updated
and revision number. By default it should keep last 10 revisions to the
offsets for each application.

Change-Id: Ib2bf7df6b32ca27c89442a23283a89fea802d146
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-03 03:05:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/monasca-transform/commit/e1490b4bd2aae499e9de7a6c5a7428e477e442ce', 'message': 'Two stage transformation

commit_message:
Two stage transformation

Breaking down the aggregation into two stages.

The first stage aggregates raw metrics frequently and is
implemented as a Spark Streaming job which
aggregates metrics at a configurable time interval
(defaults to 10 minutes) and writes the intermediate
aggregated data, or instance usage data
to new "metrics_pre_hourly" kafka topic.

The second stage is implemented
as a batch job using Spark Streaming createRDD
direct stream batch API, which is triggered by the
first stage only when first stage runs at the
top of the hour.

Also enhanced kafka offsets table to keep track
of offsets from two stages along with streaming
batch time, last time version row got updated
and revision number. By default it should keep
last 10 revisions to the offsets for each
application.

Change-Id: Ib2bf7df6b32ca27c89442a23283a89fea802d146

commit_message:
Move define-the-audit-scope blueprint

The define-the-audit-scope is not implemented yet.
The aim of this patchset is to fix that by
moving the blueprint to the newton/approved folder.

Change-Id: I0bea2b49c31fe442dd30813ef56c1f30654c4447

commit_message:
Add default rules to pick boot disk

Added migration from Fuel 8.0 to 9.0, which adds default rule
to pick bootable disk in volume metadata of release.

Change-Id: I5d151a29bf52ac3a519049c38b2b671c087f968f
Closes-Bug: #1595209

commit_message:
Always fill interface properties with default values

After upgrade of master node new interface properties
may appears in new Fuel. However, there is no way default
values to appear in the properties for nodes that were already
discovered by old Fuel.

Change-Id: I33a4d9b6303db581ea4fd6876a329e8b270da866
Closes-Bug: #1595210

deleted_lines: interface_properties = interface.interface_properties if not interface_properties: interface_properties = \ cls.get_default_interface_properties()

commit_message:

This change updates the mysql require lines to resolve lint errors.

commit_message:
Create segment_host mapping after new segment

This adds logic to add segment to host mappings for agents
after a segment is created. The previous logic was doing this
only after an agent initially reported after the server started.
This meant that any segments created after the agent was running
would not get mappings to the agent's host.

Partially-Implements: blueprint routed-networks
Change-Id: Ibcd9964afb1c7ac3926447f90b3fd364fd4835ca

commit_message:
Use osc_lib instead of cliff

Base classes of commands are defined in cliff,
but have been encapsulated again in osc-lib for
all plugin clients. So use osc-lib instead of
cliff.

Change-Id: If1427ea932f0a3d545754bfea29c9afaac22c8bd

commit_message:
Added the ip_vs kernel module to all openstack hosts

The "ip_vs" module is needed in high availability situations where
keepalived is used, specifically Neutron L3HA. Without this module
loaded the neutron l3 agent can crash like so:

    neutron_agents_container-cf16a000/modprobe.log:1:Jun 27 15:09:02
      neutron_agents_container-cf16a000 modprobe: ERROR: could not
      insert 'ip_vs': Operation not permitted ?

Change-Id: I957462f0adafcbe9655696d8f9aed7252f5c85c3
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-openstack_hosts refs/changes/98/334698/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - ip_vs

commit_message:
cinder: Fix get_size return value

When the image volume has the 'image_size' metadata, it must be
used as the size instead of volume size rounded up to GiB.

Change-Id: Id20027c9fff936a19f8c13fd7a052723b36c7a8d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance_store refs/changes/24/329824/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: return int(volume.metadata.get('image_size', volume.size * units.Gi))
deleted_lines: # GB unit convert to byte return volume.size * units.Gi

Moving test helpers to a common place

The instance booting helper functions will be reused by the
subsequent patches so it is moved to a common place.

added_lines: import time class InstanceHelperMixin(object): def _wait_for_state_change(self, admin_api, server, expected_status, max_retries=10): retry_count = 0 while True: server = admin_api.get_server(server['id']) if server['status'] == expected_status: break retry_count += 1 if retry_count == max_retries: self.fail('Wait for state change failed, ' 'expected_status=%s, actual_status=%s' % (expected_status, server['status'])) time.sleep(0.5) return server def _build_minimal_create_server_request(self, api, name): server = {} image = api.get_images()[0] if 'imageRef' in image: image_href = image['imageRef'] else: image_href = image['id'] image_href = 'http://fake.server/%s' % image_href # We now have a valid imageId server['imageRef'] = image_href # Set a valid flavorId flavor = api.get_flavors()[1] server['flavorRef'] = ('http://fake.server/%s' % flavor['id']) server['name'] = name return server

commit_message:
Add Global Actions to search page

As demonstrated in the GitHub repo, we should have global actions showing up
in the search-bar area of the search page.  This patch allows this to happen.
Please note, you need some global actions to be registered in order for this
to show up; for example, in Horizon you can use:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/334507/

Which should show Create Image at least in the list.

Change-Id: I27fceabc38932922b0961bde61c79f9f352e4474
Partially-Implements: blueprint sl-ui-use-hz-registry
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/searchlight-ui refs/changes/12/334512/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Commiting a cookie cutter module sync set of files

This module had pre-existing content which is not the
methodology puppet-openstack community advises.

This commit takes the content from their new-module
documentation and commits it to this repo as a marker
to where the module should have started.

The previous history is being kept for preservation
and will be migrated into upcoming commits to establish
a developmental history based on the cookiecutter and
msync foundation as documented by the puppet openstack
community.

Change-Id: I19189f0d5a100a3668f29d285ef3a0254f56ca51
Signed-off-by: Dan Radez <dradez@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tacker refs/changes/30/329230/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Type of service. Defaults to 'key-manager'.# Defaults to the value of 'tacker'.# [*service_description*] # (optional) Description of the service. # Default to 'tacker FIXME Service' # # [*public_url*] # (optional) The endpoint's public url. (Defaults to 'http://127.0.0.1:FIXME') # This url should *not* contain any trailing '/'. # # [*admin_url*] # (optional) The endpoint's admin url. (Defaults to 'http://127.0.0.1:FIXME') # This url should *not* contain any trailing '/'. # # [*internal_url*] # (optional) The endpoint's internal url. (Defaults to 'http://127.0.0.1:FIXME') $service_name = 'tacker', $service_description = 'tacker FIXME Service', $service_type = 'FIXME', $region = 'RegionOne', $public_url = 'http://127.0.0.1:FIXME', $admin_url = 'http://127.0.0.1:FIXME', $internal_url = 'http://127.0.0.1:FIXME', Keystone_endpoint["${region}/${service_name}::${service_type}"] ~> Service <| name == 'tacker-server' |> service_name => $service_name, service_description => $service_description, public_url => $public_url, internal_url => $internal_url, admin_url => $admin_url,
deleted_lines: # Type of service. Defaults to 'NFV'. # # [*admin_url*] # (optional) The endpoint's admin url. commit_message:
Replace dict.iterkeys with six.iterkeys to make PY3 compatible

Python3 do not use dict.iterkeys, which would raise AttributeError:
'dict' object has no attribute 'iterkeys'.

Change-Id: I97e320eac9f2f0b2cb5cf34a1d3fc57e80e440ed
Closes-Bug: #1596124

subject: Add an alternative disk provisioning method for Ceph
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-28 13:57:35.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/ceph/tasks/bootstrap_osds.yml', 'ansible/group_vars/all.yml', 'ansible/roles/ceph/tasks/start_osds_without_udev.yml', 'ansible/roles/ceph/tasks/deploy.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla/commit/3741bcf554fbc8cbd4010a027692a2d8ea4e535f', 'message': 'Add an alternative disk provisioning method for Ceph

Currently to deploy Ceph, operators are expected to apply a GPT
partition label to the disk they wish to be provisioned, and an Ansible
library script called 'find_disks.py' makes use of udev to locate the
disk based on this label.

This has two issues,

1) udev does not support the detection of GPT labels on older (but still
LTS) distros (see
https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=681809). This was also
confirmed by Sam Yaple who did the majority of the implementation on
find_disks.py

2) Some operators may not wish to use GPT

This patch provides a new variable called "ceph_disks", which allows
operators to provide a comma separated list of disks to be provisioned
on each node. This retains the properties of the existing provisioning,
but skips the use of find_disks.py.

Change-Id: Ic9cdb0e559fcaff6c8defb51dcb69363be10c1bd
Closes-Bug: #1585185
Related-Bug: #1589309
'}]
commit_message:
Add an alternative disk provisioning method for Ceph

Currently to deploy Ceph, operators are expected to apply a GPT
partition label to the disk they wish to be provisioned, and an Ansible
library script called 'find_disks.py' makes use of udev to locate the
disk based on this label.

This has two issues,

1) udev does not support the detection of GPT labels on older (but still
LTS) distros (see
https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=681809). This was also
confirmed by Sam Yaple who did the majority of the implementation on
find_disks.py

2) Some operators may not wish to use GPT

This patch provides a new variable called "ceph_disks", which allows
operators to provide a comma separated list of disks to be provisioned
on each node. This retains the properties of the existing provisioning,
but skips the use of find_disks.py.

Change-Id: Ic9cdb0e559fcaff6c8defb51dcb69363be10c1bd
Closes-Bug: #1585185
Related-Bug: #1589309
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/46/335046/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: when: inventory_hostname in groups['ceph-osd'] and ceph_disks | length == 0 - include: start_osds_without_udev.yml when: inventory_hostname in groups['ceph-osd'] and ceph_disks | length > 0

commit_message:
Config: no need to set default=None

By default oslo.cfg sets the default value as None. There is no
need to explicitly do this.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I8ba1e1d96a40f5563fba7e22af9bf02b9a7b13fa

commit_message:
[CI] Fix devstack hooks to unblock CI

Logic of share-network creation was dependent on presense of "JOB_NAME"
env var. And it is unavailable now. Moreover, we do not really need to
depend on it. Therefore, remove dependency on it and assume we always
run CI without nova-network enabled.

Change-Id: Ic03e2166101a4deb13e8a8545d2fb2506454a20a
Closes-Bug: #1595160
(cherry picked from commit 6e156835399a58bf5cabe15942a7fdc9e1104bc9)

deleted_lines: if [[ "$JOB_NAME" =~ "neutron" ]]; then DEFAULT_NEUTRON_NET=$(neutron net-show private -c id -f value) DEFAULT_NEUTRON_SUBNET=$(neutron subnet-show private-subnet -c id -f value) NEUTRON_NET=${NEUTRON_NET:-$DEFAULT_NEUTRON_NET} NEUTRON_SUBNET=${NEUTRON_SUBNET:-$DEFAULT_NEUTRON_SUBNET} manila share-network-create \ --name $SHARE_NETWORK_NAME \ --neutron-net $NEUTRON_NET \ --neutron-subnet $NEUTRON_SUBNET else DEFAULT_NOVA_NET=$(nova net-list | grep private | awk '{print $2}') NOVA_NET=${NOVA_NET:-$DEFAULT_NOVA_NET} manila share-network-create \ --name $SHARE_NETWORK_NAME \ --nova-net $NOVA_NET fi

Nova::FloatingIP get_live_state implementation

Add override get_live_state implementation for Nova::FloatingIP
resource.

implements bp get-reality-for-resources

Change-Id: Ieca08a39b36e083231815b40373e99f6ed52f2ff
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/11/254211/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_get_live_state(self): rsrc = self.prepare_floating_ip() fip = mock.MagicMock() setattr(fip, 'pool', 'public') self.novaclient.floating_ips.get('1').AndReturn(fip) self.m.ReplayAll() scheduler.TaskRunner(rsrc.create)() reality = rsrc._get_live_state() self.assertEqual({'pool': 'public'}, reality) self.m.VerifyAll() def test_get_live_state_no_prop_same_pools(self): rsrc = self.prepare_floating_ip() fip = mock.MagicMock() setattr(fip, 'pool', 'public') self.novaclient.floating_ips.get('1').AndReturn(fip) self.m.ReplayAll() scheduler.TaskRunner(rsrc.create)() rsrc.properties.data.update({'pool': None}) reality = rsrc._get_live_state() self.assertEqual({}, reality) self.m.VerifyAll() def test_get_live_state_no_prop_different_pools(self): rsrc = self.prepare_floating_ip() fip = mock.MagicMock() setattr(fip, 'pool', 'nova') self.novaclient.floating_ips.get('1').AndReturn(fip) self.m.ReplayAll() scheduler.TaskRunner(rsrc.create)() rsrc.properties.data.update({'pool': None}) reality = rsrc._get_live_state() self.assertEqual({'pool': 'nova'}, reality) self.m.VerifyAll() def test_get_live_state_not_found(self): rsrc = self.prepare_floating_ip() fip = mock.MagicMock() setattr(fip, 'pool', 'nova') self.novaclient.floating_ips.get('1').AndRaise( nova.exceptions.NotFound(404)) self.m.ReplayAll() scheduler.TaskRunner(rsrc.create)() self.assertRaises(heat_ex.EntityNotFound, rsrc._get_live_state) def test_get_live_state_other_error(self): rsrc = self.prepare_floating_ip() fip = mock.MagicMock() setattr(fip, 'pool', 'nova') self.novaclient.floating_ips.get('1').AndRaise( nova.exceptions.Conflict(500)) self.m.ReplayAll() scheduler.TaskRunner(rsrc.create)() self.assertRaises(nova.exceptions.Conflict, rsrc._get_live_state)

commit_message:
Barbican::Secret get_live_state implementation

Add override get_live_state implementation for Barbican::Secret
resource.
Note that even if resource has no updating, there should be
get_live_state implemented in case of further using in other
features.

implements bp get-reality-for-resources

Change-Id: Iece14e6e1ec758f1c60d94470e5eb7784078047f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/26/254226/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from heat.common import exception def _get_live_state(self): super(Secret, self)._get_live_state() secret_reality = {} try: secret = self.client().secrets.get(self.resource_id) except Exception as ex: if self.client_plugin().is_not_found(ex): raise exception.EntityNotFound(entity='Resource', name=self.name) raise for key in self.PROPERTIES: if hasattr(secret, key): value = getattr(secret, key) if value is not None: secret_reality.update({key: value}) return secret_reality

commit_message:
Barbican::Order get_live_state implementation

Add override get_live_state implementation for Barbican::Order
resource.
Note that even if resource has no updating, there should be
get_live_state implemented in case of further using in other
features.

implements bp get-reality-for-resources

Change-Id: I21c2f8ea712ae2f13e0d463e884aa63dd5758c98

added_lines: def test_get_reality_key(self): key = 'key' meta = { 'name': 'test', 'algorithm': 'aes', 'bit_length': '128', 'expiration': 'stub', 'payload_content_type': 'test_type', 'mode': 'test_mode' } expected = copy.deepcopy(meta) expected.update({'type': key}) self._test_get_reality(key, meta, expected) def test_get_reality_asymmetric(self): key = 'asymmetric' meta = { 'name': 'test', 'algorithm': 'aes', 'bit_length': '128', 'expiration': 'stub', 'payload_content_type': 'test_type', 'pass_phrase': 'swordfish' } expected = copy.deepcopy(meta) expected.update({'type': key}) self._test_get_reality(key, meta, expected) def test_get_reality_certificate(self): key = 'certificate' meta = { 'name': 'test', 'request_type': 'test_type', 'subject_dn': 'dn', 'container_ref': 'http::/8.0.0.1/v1/containers/505', 'ca_id': 'test_cert', 'profile': 'testProfile', 'request_data': 'test_data' } expected = copy.deepcopy(meta) expected.update({'type': key}) expected['source_container_ref'] = expected.pop('container_ref') self._test_get_reality(key, meta, expected) def _test_get_reality(self, key, add_meta, expected): res = self._create_resource('foo', self.res_template, self.stack) order = mock.MagicMock() datetime = mock.Mock() # Imitate order to_dict response order.to_dict.return_value = {'Status': u'PENDING', 'Order href': u'1234', 'Created': datetime, 'Secret href': 'N/A', 'Error message': None, 'Error code': None, 'Container href': None, 'Type': key} order._meta = add_meta for key in order._meta: setattr(order, key, order._meta[key]) self.barbican.orders.get.return_value = order reality = res._get_reality() result = copy.deepcopy(reality) for key in reality: if isinstance(reality[key], mock.MagicMock): del result[key] self.assertEqual(set(expected.keys()), set(result.keys())) for key in expected: self.assertEqual(expected[key], result.get(key)) def test_get_reality_not_found_id(self): res = self._create_resource('foo', self.res_template, self.stack) res.resource_id = None self.assertRaises(exception.EntityNotFound, res._get_reality) def test_get_reality_not_found(self): res = self._create_resource('foo', self.res_template, self.stack) self.barbican.orders.get.side_effect = [ exception.NotFound('Not Found')] self.assertRaises(exception.EntityNotFound, res._get_reality) def test_get_reality_other_error(self): res = self._create_resource('foo', self.res_template, self.stack) self.barbican.orders.get.side_effect = [ exception.NotFound('Found, but Incorrect')] self.assertRaises(exception.NotFound, res._get_reality)

commit_message:
Specify one more group for detach-rabbitmq tests for the plugin CI

We want to test detach-rabbitmq on Plugin CI. To do that, we need to
outline a set of tests we want to run on each commit. That is done with
the new 'detach-rabbitmq-ci-group' group, covering a couple of already
existing test cases. The group is intended for Plugin CI use only.

Change-Id: Ia75a39f1a3e889f4635909fdb52d993fcb11974d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-qa refs/changes/47/320447/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Validate minimum RAM for snapshot source

On launch instance there was no check for
min RAM values when launching from snapshot.
Now when launching from snapshot it will check
the same requirements as the images.

Change-Id: I138476b839319f357022f9545c5104a17a382df3
Partial-Bug: #1401101

commit_message:
Pre_delete job for MongoDB nodes

MongoDB nodes should be deleted from MongoDB cluster
first, then they can be removed from Fuel cluster.

Change-Id: I576cff80e6154d8d07bca3a60392fed3d934ae44
Closes-bug: #1513736
